channel.title: Monitor resolution fkd
channel.description: Today I was messing around on my old shit computer. I have no idea what happened, but now my resolution is too big for my monitor. I would just open up display properties and change it, but it's ATI Hydravision or Catalyst (for some reason both are installed and running) has the resolution fixed at this size so I would have to edit it via the program. Whenever that program starts up, it fucks up my monitor. The program starts up a few seconds after windows is loaded and so I have no time to even stop it from starting up. What can I do? Is there a file I can edit via Linux?

item.title: Monitor resolution fkd
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Unhandled:

Safemode exists for a reason.

Thank you my good man, totally forgot about safe mode. Managed to just uninstall all the drivers

Read full topic

@lesterknome wrote:

cows_be_sacred:

You could just end the task from an automatic start @ startup

or… Safemode, how i rid a lot of startup viruses

@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Holic, post:1, topic:308222”]Today I was messing around on my old shit computer. I have no idea what happened, but now my resolution is too big for my monitor. I would just open up display properties and change it, but it’s ATI Hydravision or Catalyst (for some reason both are installed and running) has the resolution fixed at this size so I would have to edit it via the program.
Whenever that program starts up, it fucks up my monitor. The program starts up a few seconds after windows is loaded and so I have no time to even stop it from starting up.
What can I do? Is there a file I can edit via Linux?[/quote]
There might be a configuration file, but it is probably in the registry.

Read full topic
